legal_issues: Motion to set aside a trial decision
Section 59.06(2) of Rules of Civil Procedure
outcome_details: The motion to set aside the trial decision was dismissed.
decision_factors: No new issue raised in the motion
Applicant attempted to use different legal avenues after an unfavorable decision
Court of Appeal had already addressed the issues
Applicant failed to demonstrate due diligence in obtaining evidence
Bringing collateral attacks after a decision is an abuse of process
cited_cases: International Corona Resources Ltd. v. LAC Minerals Ltd.
summary: Douglas LaFramboise sought to set aside the trial decision, alleging perjury by the respondent. The motion was dismissed as it was found to be an abuse of process, the Court of Appeal had already addressed the issues, and the applicant failed to act with due diligence to obtain evidence. The respondent was awarded costs.
